meta.content: Students, Parents, and Patrons, On behalf of the Board of Education and the USD 284 staff, welcome and thank you for being a part of our district. ​We are looking forward to the school year as...

h2.font: Help stop the spread of the coronavirus

span.style: display: block; clear: both; height: 0px; overflow: hidden;

br.font:
On behalf of the Board of Education and the USD 284 staff, welcome and thank you for being a part of our district.
​We are looking forward to the school year as the possibilities are endless.

The district’s focus is on its students. We strive to provide a safe and healthy learning environment while working toward student success. The staff is dedicated to providing learning experiences and a number of activities that will help students achieve their goals and work toward their future. We can’t do it alone; we need your participation and support. Take advantage of all the opportunities provided, and make the most of every opportunity.
I am looking forward to working with you. Together, we make USD 284 stronger for the benefit of our students.

font.font: Glenna Grinstead, USD 284 Chase County Superintendent

strong.font: New hours for the USD 284 BOE office go into effect on Nov. 25, 2019. New hours are 8 a.m. - 4:30 p.m. Monday-Friday.

h2.font: Find Summer Meals in Your Community

span.font:
Nutritious free meals are available for children and teens 18 and younger at many locations throughout the nation
throughout the summer while school is out of session. Use the following link to find a site

td.div: Check us out on social media!
